description: From Hindi तबला (tablā), from Arabic طَبْلَة‎ (ṭabla). Cognate of Catalan, Spanish, Portuguese tambor.

entries.meaning: (music) A pair of tuned hand drums, used in various musical genres of the Indian subcontinent, that are similar to bongos.
examples: Idealized membranes, plates and bars are clearly inadequate and give way to the reality of tablas, gongs and zanzas.
